instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..
definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> year 2020   I do not know the board number
threads.message:
I have no idea where the board number is on this thing.    I crossed it using ebay to a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and found a copy of that but that was wrong.

The fault I think is a common one.   The 5v filter near the display plug melted down.   The 5v rail is now down and the camera no longer works.   I dug through the bone box "not mine" and found two more boards with this exact same problem.   

I really need to trouble shoot this rail as it is down now.   So when  I fix the damage on the board there will be no power to that FET and passaves in the area anyway.  Also what is causing this on these boards?  What is the fix?  I am sure someone else as seen this!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> year 2020   I do not know the board number
threads.message:
update:  using another board I reversed the line and discovered that the via is blown somewhere in the LB.  Not sure.   But the connection to the buck converter is gone.   I am going to run a jumper.  I cannot find any reason for the failure.  There are no shorts.   So I am thinking it must be in the camera assembly not sure.

If anyone has some guidance that would be awesome.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> year 2020   I do not know the board number
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> year 2020   I do not know the board number
threads.message:
The problem must be inside LCD assembly.
Possibly flex issue...
